oai_dc:dc.dc:title: American Bread Company, circa 1952
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A multi-page pamphlet outlining the American Bread Company's production of Holsum Bread products at the Nashville plant on Murfreesboro Road. Also included are mini headshots and bios for officers and executive personnel associated with the company. A family-run bakery, the first American Bread Company store was opened on Church Street by Charles K. Evers in 1889. The state-of-the-art facility shown in this pamphlet opened in 1951. At 132,000 square feet, it was the largest and most modern bakery in the Nashville area. In 1993 the Evers family sold the business to Lewis Brothers Bakers. The building now houses the Lane Motor Museum. Forms part of the Businesses Ephemera Subject Files. 1 pamphlet : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
